intro: Roupala gracilis, commonly known as the slender roupala, is a shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its slender, multi-branched stems and small, leathery leaves. The plant produces yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, typically blooming in spring. Its growth habit makes it suitable for use in ornamental landscaping, particularly in coastal or well-drained soils. Roupala gracilis is also valued for its role in supporting local biodiversity and its resilience to various environmental conditions.
